bibl.title: Despatch from Owen L. W. Smith to David J. Hill, April 23, 1901
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p: No. 68. Consular. Legation of the United States, Monrovia Liberia, April 23, 1901.
Hon. David J. Hill Assistant Secretary of State Washington.
Subject. Acknowledged receipt of Circular, Books and other periodicals, during the month of April 1901.
No. 68. Consular. Legation of the United States, Monrovia Liberia; April 23, 1901.
Hon. David J. Hill, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington.
Sir: I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of the following publications, at this Consulate General, during the month of April 1901, viz.,

Department Circular of March 11, 1901, "Specifying Contents of packages." March 15, 1901, "Naval Calliers with merchant crews.: 2 bound volumes Census Porto Rico. Advanced sheets Consular reports, March 1901. Statement Public debt, January

January 1901. Index to advanced sheets Consular reports, 1900. Introductory of the Worlds Commerce. Consular report for the month of March 1901. Congressional Records. Notice to Mariners by the Hydrographic office March 1901. Monthly Summary of Commerce and Finance Jan. 1901. Treasury Decisions, Feb'y 1901. A general review of Foreign Trade. Report Chief of the section of Foreign markets, 1900. Trade of Denmark.
I have the honor to be your obedient servant; Owen L. W. Smith Consul General.
